thread.title: Arsenal lose highly-rated academy chief Andries Jonker as Dutch coach agrees to take Wolfsburg manager’s job
thread.title_full: Arsenal lose highly-rated academy chief Andries Jonker as Dutch coach agrees to take Wolfsburg manager’s job

author: leeastley
title: Arsenal lose highly-rated academy chief Andries Jonker as Dutch coach agrees to take Wolfsburg manager’s job
text:
Gunner to goner Arsenal lose highly-rated academy chief Andries Jonker as Dutch coach agrees to take Wolfsburg manager’s job 
Jonker took over from Liam Brady in 2014 but will leave to re-join his former club as head coach Breaking Comments ARSENAL have been dealt a blow as academy manager Andries Jonker has left to become Wolfsburg boss. 
Jonker took over from Liam Brady in 2014 but will leave to re-join his former club as head coach after signing a deal that will keep him with the Wolves until 2018. Getty Images Andires Jonker joined Arsenal in 2014 but has now left to take over at Wolfsburg Sutton United 0-2 Arsenal : Sutton’s magical FA Cup run is ended in gritty encounter 
Jonker, 54, thanked the club for the three years he had with the Gunners - who will now have to search for a new youth coach. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Andries said: "I have had a wonderful three years at Arsenal. 
"We have made significant progress and it has been great to be part of a club which puts such an emphasis on developing young players through its academy. AP:Associated Press 2 Andries Jonker was previously the assistant manager of Wolfburg before joining Arsenal 
“I leave a great team of people who will continue to do a terrific job and I would like to thank everyone, including the board, chief executive Ivan Gazidis and Arsène Wenger for all the support. 
“There are some top young players in the Arsenal academy. 
"I look forward to seeing them progress their careers." related stories Swede 'n sour 'I've won what they've won in ten years', Did Zlatan Ibrahimovic troll Arsenal after EFL Cup win? Come and get me Arsenal striker Lucas Perez is being lined up by Sevilla in the summer who will offer him regular football Gunners' Sanch swoop Man City teen Jadon Sancho is wanted by Arsenal... and transfer tussle is turning nasty OZIL'S KEBABS Arsenal star Mesut Ozil gets to work in a London kebab shop as Arsenal have a weekend off CHIPS ARE DOWN Arsenal chief Sir Chips Keswick hints club won't bow to huge wage demands of Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez TOUR DE FARCE Arsenal fans left distraught after being told Alexis Sanchez will leave the club during stadium tour 
Jonker has had a disappointing season at the Emirates after Arsenal were knocked out of the FA Youth Cup by Blackburn in the third round. 
The Gunners will have to now find a replacement and have already made contact with Barcelona's Pep Segura. 
Segura has a youth development role overseeing Barcelona B and was the former technical manager of Liverpool's academy between 2009 and 2012.
